Actually, Ginuwine was light-hearted while flashing his pearly-whites and sitting there like he actually made a new friend for life.  If you flipped that and he would have kissed this BEAUTIFUL TRANS-WOMAN then he would be dealing with backlash, that he was gay or something other than a man who likes women.  When I think of a Trans-Woman,Â I truly think of a woman, however, most Trans-Women in 2018 are sitting around hiding their truth and with that stated they are fully aware they aren't going to be everyone's 'cup of tea'.  Seeing this clip showed Ginuwine's heart was in the right place because he was honest and even them sitting there under the 'fur wraps' ( I hope and pray they were faux-fur because that would be another thing to bash him about) being chill and just talking.  Tyson Beckford  posed with aTrans Gender a few years back and that caused a stir for some time and Tyson is one of the kindest non-hatred men on the planet along with Charlamagne, who I truly do appreciate his love for the LGTBQ community.  Charlamagne is a man amongst men and okay sometimes he has his own opinions that do make me cringe just a bit but I love his honesty.  Ginuwine was playful, and down-to-earth in this clip, at least me and most people in the Transgender Community will watch this clip in its entirety and actually see an ally in Ginuwine and not someone that refused anything but spoke his truth in a loving and carefree way.  The rumor is that most minorities a.k.a. 'People Of Color' aren't just bad tippers because we are alleged to be so cheap, which is a lie because foreigners/visitors from European countries especially would be (in my experience) because in those countries tipping is truly a luxury, not a requirement.  Someone from Germany might blow a few stacks in an establishment and leave the server or bartender $10 bucks if that.  
Also, "We" (I'm Black and very, very proud; so I can write 'WE') are alleged to be the most homophobic, Transphobic and even prejudice people on the planet, which seems like the most ridiculous thing I have heard or read but it's alleged!!!!!
I do remember Bobby Brown on one of those shows overseas and one of the house-guest stepped to him in a mannerism that wasn't cool with Bobby and it was on this other level but was questioning his heterosexual nature and Bobby went off.  I had to watch and listen a few times and it was an off-color, (no pun intended ) prison joke gone bad but Bobby wasn't laughing one bit.  It really got him fired up and about to pop-off before anyone on live TV was really popping off.  On the other hand, Ginuwine pulled away and laughed but a kiss would have been rainbows, a great deal of glitter, and even butterflies for the LGTBQ community and everyone else would have flooded his life with questions and even making him question himself.  If you don't remember G had to fight off a few gay rumors throughout his career because like Channing Tatum, he too was a male exotic dancer before he became the R&B star that he is.  He handled the situation well and not in any way that should be damaging to his career, I hope, I wish and I pray.

I think it's complete bullshit that you would be called a bigot just because of your sexual preference. I'm a huge advocate of to each his or her own, do your thing. But that goes both ways. I should be able be with whoever I want to be with, and as a straight man who prefers to be with natural born women, I should be entitled to do just that. You're doing you! Male/female mating is fundamental to humanity.
